OpenBEL Framework Documentation

These are the API docs for the OpenBEL Framework.

See:
          Description

Packages
org.openbel.bel.model Low-level BEL language model constructs.
org.openbel.bel.xbel The canonical set of XBEL objects.
org.openbel.bel.xbel.model Contains the auto-generated XBEL model.
org.openbel.framework.api Framework API interfaces and supporting classes.
org.openbel.framework.api.service Service-level APIs.
org.openbel.framework.common Top-level package of the BEL framework's common module.
org.openbel.framework.common.bel.converters Converters to convert between BEL object formats.
org.openbel.framework.common.bel.parser BEL language parser, lexer, and tree walker.
org.openbel.framework.common.belscript Classes for handling BEL Script.
org.openbel.framework.common.cfg Contains BEL framework configuration capabilities.
org.openbel.framework.common.download Common classes for handling resource downloads.
org.openbel.framework.common.enums Enumerated representations of BEL structures.
org.openbel.framework.common.external Contains support for storing and retrieving types from the filesystem.
org.openbel.framework.common.index Common classes for handling equivalences and indexed resources.
org.openbel.framework.common.lang Contains the immutable BEL language model.
org.openbel.framework.common.lock Common classes for low-level locking functionality.
org.openbel.framework.common.model The BEL common model.
org.openbel.framework.common.protonetwork.model Contains the proto network object model.
org.openbel.framework.common.record The next generation of resource processing and access in the framework.
org.openbel.framework.common.util Utilities common to all of BEL.
org.openbel.framework.common.xbel.converters A set of converters to and from the XBEL format.
org.openbel.framework.common.xbel.parser Service-level XBEL support.
org.openbel.framework.compiler Contains the reference implementation of the BEL compiler.
org.openbel.framework.compiler.kam Compiler KAM store functionality.
org.openbel.framework.core BEL services and business logic.
org.openbel.framework.core.annotation Services for handling annotations and annotation definitions.
org.openbel.framework.core.cache Services related to the framework's cache.
org.openbel.framework.core.compiler Core compiler services (i.e., phases).
org.openbel.framework.core.compiler.expansion Definitions and services for term and statement expansion within the framework.
org.openbel.framework.core.df Contains the JDBC database framework utilities.
org.openbel.framework.core.df.beldata Captures the common header model and parser framework for bel data files (namespaces, equivalences, annotations).
org.openbel.framework.core.df.beldata.annotation Captures the annotation definition file's header model (.belanno file).
org.openbel.framework.core.df.beldata.equivalence Captures the equivalence file's header model (.beleq file).
org.openbel.framework.core.df.beldata.namespace Captures the namespace file's header model (.belns file).
org.openbel.framework.core.df.cache Data-centric access to the framework cache mechanisms.
org.openbel.framework.core.df.encryption BEL data encryption services.
org.openbel.framework.core.df.encryption.model BEL encryption model.
org.openbel.framework.core.df.external Data-centric access to external resources.
org.openbel.framework.core.equivalence Provides the mechanisms to perform equivalencing throughout BEL.
org.openbel.framework.core.indexer Indexes BEL data files for efficient lookup.
org.openbel.framework.core.kam Definitions and services regarding KAM and KAM loading.
org.openbel.framework.core.kamstore Core KAM store objects.
org.openbel.framework.core.kamstore.data.jdbc Contains the jdbc commands to retrieve a KAM from the KAMstore.
org.openbel.framework.core.kamstore.model Contains the KAMStore model objects.
org.openbel.framework.core.kamstore.model.dialect Support for talking different dialects of KAMs.
org.openbel.framework.core.kamstore.model.filter Criteria classes providing filtering capabilities around KAMs.
org.openbel.framework.core.namespace Namespace-centric services for index, resolution, and referencing of symbols.
org.openbel.framework.core.protocol Understands and downloads resources from multiple protocols.
org.openbel.framework.core.protocol.handler BEL protocol handlers and implementation utilities.
org.openbel.framework.core.protonetwork Compiles a BEL document into a proto-network.
org.openbel.framework.tools Contains BEL tools.
org.openbel.framework.tools.kamstore Tools written around KAM operations.
org.openbel.framework.tools.pkam Portable KAM support.
org.openbel.framework.tools.rdf RDF-centric KAM support and vocabulary.
org.openbel.framework.tools.xgmml XGMML exporting.
org.openbel.framework.ws.client Contains the deprecated web service client model.
org.openbel.framework.ws.client.example Deprecated web service client examples.
org.openbel.framework.ws.core Core web service classes.
org.openbel.framework.ws.dialect Dialect-centric web services.
org.openbel.framework.ws.endpoint Web sevice endpoints.
org.openbel.framework.ws.model Contains the auto-generated web services model.
org.openbel.framework.ws.service Web service definitions and implementations.
org.openbel.framework.ws.utils Web service utilities.

 

These are the API docs for the OpenBEL Framework.

Style

Indentation
  • Four spaces should be used as the unit of indentation.
  • Indent with spaces, not tabs.
  • Indentation should be consistent.

Line Length

  • Avoid lines longer than 80 characters.

Brace Usage

  • Conditionals should always use braces.
  • Braces in loops can be considered optional, e.g.,
    for (int i = 0; i < array.length; methodcall(array[i]), i++);
Switch Statements
  • Switch statements should always include default cases.

Blank Usage

  • Keywords followed by parantheses
  • Commas in arguments lists
  • Expressions in for loops
  • Binary operators, except '.'
  • After casts

E.g.,
  • if (...) { /// }
  • method(a, b, c);
  • for (int i = 0; i < j; j++) { // }
  • list.add((T) item);

Documentation

  • Document all public, default and protected elements
  • Document all thrown exceptions
  • Use the tags and tools provided (e.g., use of inheritDoc)
  • Document when nulls are accepted or returned for a method

Examples, note the use of may be language: 
        
          /**
           * Creates an item.
           *
           * @param e Entry, which may be null
           */
          public Item(Entry e) {
              this.entry = e;
          }

          /**
           * Returns the item's entry.
           *
           * @return Entry, which may be null
           */
          public Entry getEntry() {
              return entry;
          }

          /**
           * Returns the item's other entries.
           *
           * @return Set of entries, which may be empty
          public Set getEntries() {
              if (entries == null) return emptySet();
              return entries;
          }

Conventions

Catching Exceptions

Avoid catching higher-level exceptions; there are seldom reasons to do so. 
            
              try {
                  // some code
              } catch (Exception e) {
                  // Don't!
              }

Naming Conventions

  • Constants should be uppercase with words separated by '_'.
  • Consider case-senstivity when naming types.
    E.g., do not use:
                    
                  public class Bel {
                  }
    Do use: 
                    
                  public class BEL {
                  }

Simplify Logic

Simplify conditional logic, when execution flows throw branches in a mutually exclusive fashion.
E.g., avoid using:
            
              if (condition1) {
                  // some code for condition #1
                  return;
              } else if (condition2) {
                  // some code for condition #2
                  return;
              } else {
                  // default code
                  return;
              }
Do use:
            
              if (condition1) {
                  // some code for condition #1
                  return;
              } else if (condition2) {
                  // some code for condition #2
                  return;
              }
              // default code
              return;
The latter syntax matches intent and allows for things like branch prediction by the virtual machine.

Unnecessary Code

Unnecessary code usually comes as a result of software maturity during phases of refactoring. Here are the types of unnecessary code that should be avoided:
  • Unnecessary null checks
  • Unnecessary else statements
  • Unnecessary casts, instanceof
  • Unused imports
